column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tell Your Parent or Guardians You Need Mental Help
#Text=Mental illness can feel scary .
#Text=Your neurons are working in ways that you cannot rationally control , and you face stigma and disbelief from others .
#Text=Needing to tell your parent(s) or guardian(s) can make an already frightening situation even more terrifying .
#Text=However , with thought and preparation , the task can be overcome .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Do your research .
#Text=Read up on your symptoms , and find a few potential disorders that match your symptoms .
#Text=( It is best not to latch onto one single diagnosis , to prevent bias during the professional diagnostic process . )
#Text=Read both medical descriptions , and descriptions from people who have the disorders .
#Text=Consider the fact that you may not be mentally ill , but may have a neurological disorder ( such as autism ) , a food allergy , or another illness that needs treating .
#Text=Be prepared to field questions from your parents/guardians .
#Text=They 'll take time to adjust to the news .
#Text=Be ready to respond to questions and comments such as :
#Text=How long have you felt like this ?
#Text=How severe is it ?
#Text=( Reflect on your past to think of several examples that demonstrate something is unusual with your brain . )
#Text=Could you have something else ?
#Text=( You can show them the disorders that best matched your symptoms , and mention the disorders that you researched and ruled out . )
#Text=What sort of treatment do you think you need ?
#Text=Pick a good time to talk .
#Text=You want to minimize stress for both you and your parent(s)/guardian(s ) .
#Text=An ideal time is when ...
#Text=There are no major tasks to be done at the moment .
#Text=Try long car rides , quiet meals , washing dishes after supper , etc.
#Text=Both you and they feel relaxed .
#Text=You can speak in private without likely interruptions .
#Text=You can access a computer or papers with some of your research ( optional ) .
#Text=Get straight to the point .
#Text=For example , " Dad , I have something important to tell you and I really need your attention .

#Text=Tell them your symptoms before coming out and saying you think you have a mental disorder , as it will likely be easier to start the conversation with something like ,  Mom , lately I 've been doing_(add symptom)__ and I 've been feeling _(add emotion)_ " You could finish with saying something like , " So , this was really worrying me .
